inlineContent.text: Gnusto is a powerful, flexible framework for creating interactive fiction games. Drawing inspiration from the classic Infocom games, it provides a modern Swift-based toolkit that makes building rich, dynamic text adventures easy and enjoyable.

abstract.text: A registry to hold dynamically computed logic and validation rules for properties.
Identifies the specific entity whose state is being changed.
Handles the “WEAR” context.command and its synonyms (e.g., “DON”).
Represents the complete, mutable state of the game world at a given point in time.
Handles the “TOUCH” context.command and its synonyms (e.g., “FEEL”, “RUB”, “PAT”).
Represents a side effect of an action (e.g., starting a fuse, running a daemon).
Result of an action execution with enhanced information.
A unique identifier for an item (GameObject) within the game world.
Handles the “LOCK
WITH
” context.command.
A unique identifier for a piece of contextual data relevant to an action.
A protocol for types that define a collection of related game locations and items, forming
a logical region or area within the game world.
Represents a background task or routine that runs periodically during the game.
Represents stylistic hints for text output.
A unique identifier for a location within the game world.
A standard implementation of the Parser protocol.
Aims to replicate common ZIL parser behaviors.
Represents an interactive object in the game world.
Action handler for the DEBUG verb.
A unique identifier for a standard or dynamic property within the game.
Defines a Daemon, a process that runs periodically.
Handles the “TAKE” context.command and its synonyms (e.g., “GET”).
Represents the possible types of values that can be tracked in state changes.
Ensures values are both Codable and Sendable.
Represents the different events that can trigger an ItemEventHandler.
Represents a recognized verb in the game’s command vocabulary.
Enhanced
protocol with distinct validation, processing, and post-processing steps.
Provides contextual information relevant to the execution of a specific action.
Handles the “CLOSE” context.command.
Represents a parsed player command, ready for execution.
Determines visibility and reachability of items and locations based on game state,
primarily considering light conditions.
Stores definitions for various game elements like Fuses, Daemons, and custom action handlers.
This registry allows the engine to look up definitions by their IDs.
Handles the “READ” context.command.
Represents a reference to a game entity, which can be an item, a location, or the player.
This provides a type-safe way to specify the target of a command.
Represents the possible parents of an Item in the game hierarchy, determining its location
or containment state.
Defines the core metadata constants for an interactive fiction game.
Enumerates errors that can occur during the command parsing phase.
Represents the different events that can trigger a RoomActionHandler.
Represents a timed event scheduled to occur after a specific number of turns.
This document outlines the phased plan to refactor the Gnusto Engine’s state management for increased robustness, testability, and clarity, while maintaining good developer ergonomics.
Type alias for a closure that handles room-specific actions based on game events.

for a given command.
Holds the game’s vocabulary, mapping words to game entities and concepts.
Represents the state of the player character.

Handles the “LOOK” context.command and its synonyms (e.g., “L”, “EXAMINE”).

Based on the analysis of the Inform 6 “Cloak of Darkness” source, the next major phase of development for the Gnusto engine will focus on enhancing dynamic content generation and action handling. This phase aims to replicate the flexibility and power of classic IF systems like Inform 6 while maintaining modern Swift practices and SOLID principles.
Represents cardinal and other directions used for navigation and spatial representation.
Handles the “OPEN” context.command.
Handles movement context.commands (e.g., “GO NORTH”, “NORTH”, “N”).
Handles the “EXAMINE” context.command and its synonyms (e.g., “LOOK AT”, “DESCRIBE”).
Enumerates the types of possible side effects.
Handles the “UNLOCK
WITH
” context.command.
Represents a specific syntax pattern for a verb.
Represents a change in game state.
Handles the “INVENTORY” context.command and its synonyms (e.g., “I”).
Defines the specific state property being modified.
Represents the type of element expected at a position in a SyntaxRule pattern.

that interacts with the standard console.
Defines the interface for a command parser.
Handles the “REMOVE” context.command and its synonyms (e.g., “DOFF”, “TAKE OFF”).
An item event handler.
Represents a connection from one location to another in a specific direction.
Handles the “DROP” context.command and its synonyms (e.g., “PUT DOWN”).
A unique identifier for a verb within the game’s vocabulary.
Action handler for the THINK ABOUT verb (based on Cloak of Darkness).

The main orchestrator for the interactive fiction game.
This actor manages the game state, handles the game loop, interacts with the parser
and IO handler, and executes player commands using registered ActionHandlers.

Using an OptionSet allows combining multiple conditions.
